description.narrative: B. MIPAREC, as many other Burundian NGOs, has governance problems. It has gaps in its organizational structures, both administrative, financial and executive. It struggles to keep the separation among executive power and administration. This strongly affects its decision making, transparency, accountability and thus its growth and its possibility to attract new donors. MIPAREC will undergo a tailor-made support in reinforcing their governance, comprising of: organisational diagnostic of the actual situation and its gaps; a participative workshop with all MIPAREC’s staff to present the study’s results, prioritize recommendations and create an action plan; organisational coaching and training of MIPAREC’s senior management according to the action plan ; follow-up and correction on the action plan’s progresses.

participating-org.narrative:
Ministry of Peace and Reconciliation Under the Cross (Mi-PAREC) is a non-profit organization, founded in 1996 by the laureates of training in peaceful conflict resolution and integrated development. Mi-PAREC was approved by ministerial decree n ° 530-114of 02/21/2002.
The association was founded to promote peace and reconciliation in Burundi first, then in the Great Lakes region (Rwanda, DRC) then and finally throughout the world. Mi-PAREC is made up of members who are motivated by a spirit of commitment and volunteerismand who emphasize social sense to help the marginalized such as the displaced, returnees, demobilized, people affected by the crisis, people affected by diseases like HIV / AIDS, poverty, etc.
Mi-PAREC helps in the creation and support of local peace and community recovery initiatives through peace committees, solidarity groups and other groups or clubs. It provides lessons through seminars,workshops where community representatives, administrative and political authorities, military, representatives of civil society participate to discuss their role in the construction of the country and promote peace and sustainable development.
MIPAREC's vision is to build a peaceful, equitable and prosperous society.Our mission is to work to promote peace, community development and social cohesion through training, reconciliation and peacebuilding activities. Integrity: We value the integrity of staff individually and inthe way we engage with others in all aspects of work.
-Non violence: Our actions and our words must reflect the qualities of a peacemaker. You have to act in a way that does not harm others. This is why our motto is "MIPAREC against all forms of violence"
-Learning Culture: We firmly believe that no one is an expert in everything; but that any intervention must be an object of learning a new lesson. We assess all stakeholders that everyone has something to contribute, which is why MIPAREC staff are not teachers but "facilitators" and participants are not beneficiariesbut "neighbors".
-Equality and equity: Everyone is created in the image of God. This requires treating people fairly and equally.
-Honesty and transparency: We must be honest and transparent in everything we do because we are not only accountable to people but also to the Almighty.
-Love: You have to love others to be able to serve them. Without this love, you become a mercenary.
